title: 112_hr4265
content: The Act is titled the "Shared Responsibility in Preserving America's Future Act" and includes a surtax on millionaires contingent on the passage of a balanced budget amendment or spending limit amendment. This surtax is added as a new part to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Shared Responsibility in Preserving America's Future Act" imposes a 5% tax on taxpayers (excluding corporations) with modified adjusted gross income exceeding $1,000,000 for taxable years between 2012 and 2023. The threshold amount is subject to inflation adjustments after 2013. After 2013, the $1,000,000 threshold for the tax increases annually based on the cost-of-living adjustment for the calendar year, rounded to the nearest $10,000. For married individuals filing separately, the rules apply for taxable years. The threshold amount for tax increases annually based on the cost-of-living adjustment, rounded to the nearest $10,000. For married individuals filing separately, the threshold amount is one-half of the amount for the taxable year. Modified adjusted gross income is calculated by reducing adjusted gross income by the excess of gross income from a non-passive trade or business. The term 'modified adjusted gross income' is defined as adjusted gross income reduced by the excess of gross income from a non-passive trade or business over deductions properly allocable to such income. The Secretary is authorized to prescribe regulations. The Secretary will prescribe regulations similar to section 469(l) for determining income under paragraph (1)(A). Special rules apply for nonresident alien individuals and citizens/residents living abroad. The tax imposed under section 871(b) applies to alien individuals. For citizens and residents living abroad, the dollar amount under subsection (a) is adjusted based on income exclusions and deductions. Charitable trusts are exempt from subsection (a). The tax imposed under section 871(b) applies to alien individuals, with adjustments for income exclusions and deductions for citizens and residents abroad. Charitable trusts are exempt from this tax. The tax under this section is not considered for certain credits or for section 55 purposes. Application of this section is contingent on a Balanced Budget or Spending Limit Amendment. The tax under section 871(b) applies to alien individuals, with adjustments for income exclusions and deductions for citizens and residents abroad. Charitable trusts are exempt from this tax. The application of this section is contingent on a Balanced Budget or Spending Limit Amendment. The text discusses a proposed spending limit amendment to the Constitution of the United States, with a deadline for certification by the President. It also mentions that the amendment must be ratified by a certain date to become valid. Additionally, a clerical amendment is made to the Internal Revenue Code. The amendment made by subsection (a) regarding a surtax on millionaires does not change the tax rate according to section 15 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The effective date for these amendments is for taxable years starting after December 31, 2012.
